titleStmt.title: SalTEI: "The School of Salamanca" TEI Customization
titleStmt.author: generated by Roma 5.0.1, Cindy Rico Carmona David Glück, Andreas Wagner

publicationStmt.p: For use by whoever wants it.

sourceDesc.p: Born digital, created on Wednesday 19th March 2014, last updated 2021-01-27

listChange.change: Added "epilogue" and description to the possible div/@type(s).
Added further descriptions of div/@type values.
Added attributes and values for list, cell, label, language, typeDesc.
Made @xml:id for signed, label and lg mandatory.

change.p: Deleted title/@type[. eq '245a'].
Added 'administrative' as div/@type value.
Added series element to core module.
Added msdescription to modules; small additions/changes.
Withdraw removal of att.global.change; add element space (module transcr); add values "#AA" (automatic annotation), "#CRC" and "#DG" to @resp.
Add value "unknown" to unclear/@reason, div/@type, and milestone/@unit; add values "#right" and "#gap" to @rendition.
Add title page elements: docAuthor, docImprint, byline, imprimatur, docDate; update status labels; change name of TEI specification to "SalTEI".
Add XInclude elements.
Remove @style and @rend from att.global.rendition class and add hi @rendition value for "recte".
remove value "sub" of title@type; date@type="summaryFirstEd|summaryThisEd", remove "summary".
Added title@type=245a, ref@type=catLink,institution, date@type=summary

listChange.change: Allow text@xml:id to be VolXY (with a capital 'V') instead of volXY, so as to match how the xml files are actually called.
specified dictionary and analysis elements replaced exclude- with include-specifications in some moduleRef instances made @status an optional attribute in revisionDesc

change.p: Relaxes a few parts (keeping this more in synch with the author schema).

list.item: Reactivated attribute deletions in att.classes removals
added required xml:id attributes in certain elements
replace @who with @resp in definitions of responsibilty (gap, supplied etc.)
use tei_odd schema for this odd file

change.p:
Modifications to cater for Editorial Guidelines (in W_Head_general.xml):
remove "#code" from hi@rendition - use code instead, once we have the tagdocs module.
allow ref type="image"

Modifications to cater for Editorial Guidelines (in W_Head_general.xml):
add "#code" to hi@rendition
add tagdocs module
clear up classspec definitiones which are used to delete the whole class of attributes anyway
add "#l-ident" to hi@rendition values
cope with damage/del and gap/unclear/supplied elements
narrow down and explain docStatus values (and remove the revisionStmt element from att.docStatus so that it does not need to have a status itself).
extend text types to cover lemma-/author articles and working papers
add gaiji module.
consolidate @types of text and div elements.
remove category/taxonomy elements since we won't be using them.
change list and ref elements to use summaries/summary respectively.
add "monograph" to possible values of text@type.
text@type is only optional. (and whitespace formatting.)
Synched partly with http://dfg-viewer.de/strukturdatenset/, this concerns specific types of div and text tags.
Also allowed biblscope tag as it is used in seriesStmt.

Removed @synch (it means sync in time, for speech transcription)and defined list@rendition values (like dta does as per www.deutsches-textarchiv.de/doku/basisformat_texterschliessung_formal#Klammerungen. Changed @status to an xml name data type (without '/'). Also re-shuffled *Spec-entries to sort on @ident.

body.p: TEI customization for primary source texts established by the project "The School of Salamanca" of the Academy of Sciences and of Literature, Mainz, Germany. Contact info.salamanca@adwmainz.de for more information.

attDef.desc: Key that identifies the referenced work in the project's web application.
Schlüssel, über den die Zitation in der Webapp identifiziert wird.

valItem.desc: Just converted to TEI.
Uncertainty marks resolved.
Hyphenation, correction and abbr. expansion suggestions.
Hyphenation, correction and abbr. expansion suggestions approved and implemented.
Enrichment (entity annotation, linking, etc.) in process.
Enrichment done, pending four-eye cross-check.
Enrichment approved, work publicly and persistently released.
Further corrections/enrichment done, pending four-eye cross-check.
Temporarily suspended.
Further corrections/enrichment approved, re-release.
Final version for archival of project results.
The first print edition of a work/volume.
The print edition of a work/volume used for the digital collection of sources. (NOTE: Only necessary if our edition is NOT the first print edition, otherwise use "firstEd".)
The digital edition of a work/volume.
A summary of the publication history of a digital multivolume work
A summary of the imprint history of the first edition of a multivolume work
A summary of a multivolume work's imprint history used in our collection of sources. (NOTE: Only necessary if our edition is NOT the first print edition, otherwise use "firstEd".)
A section, usually occurring within the front or back matter of a text, that contains statements about administrative matters such as censorship, taxation, or permissions.
A section labeled as 'article' (e.g., 'articulus')
A section labeled as 'book' (e.g., 'Liber' or 'Libro')

A chapter, labeled as such (as given in the chapter heading, for example) or clearly identifiable as such through the context. (Parts of chapters that are not specifically labeled otherwise are usually annotated as 'section'.)
A statement about the publication of a work/volume (place, date, printer, etc.), usually occurring at its end.
A section that serves as a commentary to an other section taken from a different work (to be labeled as "source").
A section that serves as a conclusion for some other section.
A section of the text listing structural units of the text, or of a certain part of the text.
A section listing corrigenda/errata, usually in the front or back matter of a text.
A section labeled as 'dict' contains in a deeper 'div' level several 'entry's .
A section labeled as 'disputatio', or something that is equivalent.
A section labeled as 'Dubium', or something that is equivalent.
Sections contained in a division called 'dict'.
A piece of writing at the end of a work used to bring closure.
An opening statement, usually written by someone other than the author of the work. This includes statements in prose form as well as statements in verse (such as epigrams).
A structural section labeled as 'Glossa', or something that is equivalent.
An index.
A section labeled as 'Lex', or as something equivalent.
A section labeled as 'relectio', or as an equivalent to 'relectio'.
A larger part of the work/volume that is usually labeled as 'Pars'/'Parte' (or something equivalent), usually comprising structural sub-units such as chapters, sections, etc.
A section specially labeled as 'Partida' (not to be confused with @type='part').
A section labeled as 'Lex', or as something equivalent.
An introductory statement about the work/volume, written by its author.
A section labeled as 'quaestio' (or as something equivalent).

A somewhat arbitrary label for sections of any size, usually occurring in the main body of a work/volume. NOTE: for sections labeled as 'Sectio' (or something equivalent) please refer to @type='segment').
A section labeled as 'Sectio', or as something equivalent.
A section from a different work (possibly by a different author), embedded in the current text.
A section labeled as 'Titulus'/'Titulo', or as something equivalent.

In case none of the available values of @type applies to a structural unit of a document, 'unknown' may be used, but only for validation of the document and as a marker to be resolved through further scholarly editing.
A part of a document that has been split for technical reasons.

valItem.gloss: grouping brace, pointing to the left
grouping brace, pointing to the right

attDef.desc: The @facs attribute contains a pointer or link to the file representing the image scan of the page that is beginning here. Since we are using private URI schemes, this has to begin with a "facs" prefix. Next comes the work number, volume identifier and (four-digit) page number (and no extension). The prefix is separated with a colon (":") from the rest, whereas work number, volume identifier and page number are separated with dashes ("-"). A complete example: "facs:W0001-A-0228" (Page 228 of the first volume of work W0001).

valItem.desc: Just converted to TEI.
Uncertainty marks resolved.
Hyphenation, correction and abbr. expansion suggestions.
Hyphenation, correction and abbr. expansion suggestions approved and implemented.
Enrichment (entity annotation, linking, etc.) in process.
Enrichment done, pending four-eye cross-check.
Enrichment approved, work publicly and persistently released.
Further corrections/enrichment done, pending four-eye cross-check.
Temporarily suspended.
Further corrections/enrichment approved, re-release.
Final version for archival of project results.
A part of a document that has been splitted for technical reasons.
A snippet with recent news of the project.
A document needed for technical reasons, schema, doc etc.

attDef.desc: Only to use in the TEI-header. (classifies the title according to some convenient typology).
Use: required in the TEI-header. (classifies the title according to some convenient typology).
Only to use in the body. provides an externally-defined means of identifying the entity (or entities) being named, using an URI.
Only to use in the body. provides an externally-defined means of identifying the entity (or entities) being named, using a coded value of some kind.
